sources.full: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table & Magic Items

baseitem.name: Chain-Sickle
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This weapon is a sickle on a chain with a heavy weight at the opposite end of the chain.

item.name: Aficionado's Stamp Seal
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This carnelian stamp seal assumes an impression design that suits its purpose; otherwise, it is blank. While attuning to this stamp seal, you must choose a {@table tools|phb|tool} with which you are proficient. You add your Intelligence mod to any checks you make with that tool, and if you would already add your Intelligence mod to the check, you add it twice.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This item is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a remove curse spell or similar magic. As long as you remain cursed, you cannot discard the seal, which immediately teleports back into your pocket or pack. You are unwilling to part with it, keeping it on your person at all times.

item.name: Bracer of the Retiarius
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This leather bracer is carved with a cross-hatch relief. While wearing the Bracer of the Retiarius you are skilled with the use of the {@item net|phb} as a weapon if you weren't already, and being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't imposive disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with a net. Additionally, your net attacks are effective against Huge and smaller creatures.

item.name: The Civilization Disk
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This brass disk depicts a pop-up latticework of causeways and canals, defenses and dwellings. If within a city's limits for at least 24 hours, The Civilization Disk will gradually assume the basic layout of the city, and retain this layout until it enters another city, at which point it immediately loses its prior layout.

item.name: Floppy Coin
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: An antique coin so lackadaisical it can be draped over most objects. While in possession of this coin, you are immune to the {@condition petrified} condition, and if you choose to, you can sleep through anything.

item.name: Font of the Great Bath
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This flask contains bathwater that glints like a sunny sea. When you begin a long rest, you may quaff the contents of this flask. If you do, the bathwater cleanses you of any curses, and up to three levels of {@condition exhaustion}. The Font of the Great Bath refills itself in {@dice 1d10} days.

item.name: Gloves of the Cache
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: These three-fingered deerskin gloves enable a nuanced grip. While you wear the Gloves of the Cache you are proficient with Ammunition, which deals {@dice 1d6} piercing damage and has the following properties: Light, Finesse, Thrown (Range 20/40).

item.name: +1 Golden Hand Crossbow
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This gold-plated hand crossbow is inhabited by the soul of a drow weapons master. When you score a killing blow with this hand crossbow, you may use it to make a free attack on a target within range, which ignores the weapon's Loading property. You can only benefit from this property once per round.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

item.name: +2 Golden Hand Crossbow
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This gold-plated hand crossbow is inhabited by the soul of a drow weapons master. When you score a killing blow with this hand crossbow, you may use it to make a free attack on a target within range, which ignores the weapon's Loading property. You can only benefit from this property once per round.
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

item.name: +3 Golden Hand Crossbow
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This gold-plated hand crossbow is inhabited by the soul of a drow weapons master. When you score a killing blow with this hand crossbow, you may use it to make a free attack on a target within range, which ignores the weapon's Loading property. You can only benefit from this property once per round.
You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

item.name: Helm of Contamination
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This bronze hoplite helmet is marred by patina that resembles festering wounds. Whenever you witness an action that would heal a creature, you can use your reaction to force that creature to make a DC15 Constitution save. On a failed save, the target is {@condition poisoned} and all healing it receives is halved for one minute, including the healing that triggered this effect. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you have completed a short or long rest.

item.name: Lucky Cat's Paw
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This cat's paw siphons a portion of the Universe's finite fortune to impart upon its owner. Two rolls are made whenever you invoke a roll on the {@table The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat}, and you choose one of the two to keep.

item.name: Mira's Legendary Chest
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This heavy trunk has the name "Mira" carved into its lid. The trunk appears empty, and refuses storage deposits. As a free action, you can reach into this trunk and pull out a random improvised weapon that is considered magical. Weapons procured in this manner return from whence they came either after one minute has passed or when another improvised weapon is pulled from the chest, whichever comes first.

item.name: Miserable Bag of Bones
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This lumpy canvas sack exudes a deep dark aura, and yearns for company. You may use your reaction to reduce any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see by a number equal to the sum of the creature types for which this bag contains a bone. Using this ability consumes and disintegrates all unattended bones within 100 feet of a random creature type for which this bag contains a bone, including the bones in the bag. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you have completed a long or short rest.
The miserable bag of bones is first found with {@dice 1d12} humanoid bones.

item.name: Ring of Propagation
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This unsightly ring crawls with bruise-like splotches. As an action, you can use this ring to target a creature you can see that is suffering from a condition that isn't a result of having been reduced to 0HP. All creatures within 30 feet of that creature must make a DC15 Constitution save or suffer the same condition or conditions for the next minute, repeating the save at the end of each of their turns. Once this property has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Satchel of Vibrating Petals
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This satchel contains {@dice 1d20} vibrating multicolored petals. Consuming a petal increases your movement speed by 5 feet until you finish a long rest. You may only increase your movement speed by 5 feet in this manner.

item.name: Shield of Serration
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: The edge of this targe bristles with jagged teeth. While wielding the Shield of Serration you can make attacks with shields as if you were proficient, and shields you attack with deal {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage and have the Thrown (range 20/60) property.

item.name: Sindoor Dragon Clasp
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This bold red clasp will secure even the most common cloak with flair. This clasp has 7 charges for the following properties, and regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the clasp turns to ash and is destroyed.

entries.name: Spells
entries: Cast the {@spell Fire Shield} spell. (Consumes 2 Charges)

entries.name: Flare Ward
entries: You can use your reaction to envelop with your cloak either yourself or a Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of you, shielding the target completely against an attack or spell that would deal fire damage. (Consumes 5 Charges).

item.name: Staff of the Underworld Denizen
item.reqAttune: by a sorceror, warlock, or wizard
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This staff is a length of inconspicuous, matte-black metal.

entries.name: Aware
entries: While holding the staff, other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

entries.name: Prepared
entries: The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell Disguise Self} (1 Charge), {@spell Invisibility} (2 charges), {@spell Find Traps} (2 charges), {@spell See Invisibility} (2 charges), or {@spell Clairvoyance} (3 charges). The staff regains {@dice 1d10} charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff turns into smoke and is destroyed.

item.name: Throne of the Mistress
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This high-back upholstered chair emanates power and class. The Throne of the Mistress has a fly speed of 20 feet (hover), but cannot fly higher than two feet. The Throne can hold up to 500 pounds, and if more weight is placed on it, it falls to the ground. A creature seated in the chair can control its movement with simple mental commands.

item.name: Writhing- and Reaching-Hands Flail
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: Three writhing and reaching arms are bolted at the elbow to the haft of this flail. When you hit with an attack using this magic weapon, the target takes an extra {@dice 1d8} psychic damage. When you roll a 20 on the {@dice d20} for an attack roll with this weapon, the writhing and reaching hands grasp the target, transmitting visions of cosmic horror, and the target is {@condition frightened} of you until the end of its next turn. When you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an attack roll with this weapon, you glimpse these same visions, and are {@condition frightened} of your target until the end of your next turn, in addition to any other consequences.

magicvariant.name: +1 Iridescent Weapon

entries: This weapon's iridescent sheen courses in eddies and streams. As a bonus action, you may cause this weapon to seep enough iridescent oil to cover a 10-foot square, making it difficult terrain for everyone but you. Instead, you move at double speed while in the square—moving two feet in the area costs one foot of speed. The oil dissipates after one minute, and you can't use this property again until you've completed a short or long rest.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

The oil dissipates after one minute, and you can't use this property again until you've completed a short or long rest.
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Instead, you move at double speed while in the square—moving two feet in the area costs one foot of speed. The oil dissipates after one minute, and you can't use this property again until you've completed a short or long rest.
You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

magicvariant.name: +1 Psychic Wind Weapon

entries: This weapon trails an ephemeral window into the Astral Plane, like brush strokes of silvery paint that are quick to dissipate. On a successful hit, you may choose to stir a localized psychic wind. If you do, your weapon trails buffet the target, which must make a DC15 Intelligence save or suffer an effect from the {@table Short-Term Madness} table. If the target fails the save, you can't use this property of the weapon until you finish a short or long rest.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

magicvariant.name: +1 Vertigo Weapon

entries: This otherwise normal-looking weapon causes your hand to sway when wielded. Damage dealt with this weapon is considered damage taken from a fall (not an attack), but retains its weapon's damage type.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

itemGroup.name: Golden Hand Crossbow
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat
entries: This gold-plated hand crossbow is inhabited by the soul of a drow weapons master. When you score a killing blow with this hand crossbow, you may use it to make a free attack on a target within range, which ignores the weapon's Loading property. You can only benefit from this property once per round. This weapon is obtained as either a +1, +2, or +3 magical weapon—whichever is appropriate for your party level.

itemGroup.name: Iridescent Weapon
lootTables: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table|SCat

As a bonus action, you may cause this weapon to seep enough iridescent oil to cover a 10-foot square, making it difficult terrain for everyone but you. Instead, you move at double speed while in the square—moving two feet in the area costs one foot of speed. The oil dissipates after one minute, and you can't use this property again until you've completed a short or long rest. This weapon is obtained as either a +1, +2, or +3 magical weapon—whichever is appropriate for your party level.

This weapon is obtained as either a +1, +2, or +3 magical weapon—whichever is appropriate for your party level.

table.name: The Gacha Box d1000 Loot Table
table.caption: d1000 Loot Table
intro: The Gacha Box's primary function is as a wildly-variable mostly-junk loot table for when you've no clue what that well bottom was meant to hold. But it has a more involved, optional use as well:

Most of what you find on the table, no matter how flavorful, isn't special. It's the magic items, and other exceptional or curious items, that are meant to entice players to use, or crank, the Gacha Box. Your Gacha Box can work however you like, and I recommend you tailor it for your party and campaign. For those of you who want a reference on-hand:

items: Players can each crank the Gacha Box once per day.
Cranking the Gacha Box costs 2–10 coins of basic currency (inserted into the coin slot before cranking).
Give players an idea of the magical items they have a chance of winning.

Whenever a player first cranks the Gacha Box, they receive a Gacha Ticket. If a player with a Gacha Ticket cranks the Gacha Box, that player's Gacha Ticket is stamped. Upon receiving the fifth such stamp, that player is immediately granted a free crank, and their stamps are reset.
The Gacha Box is immune to all damage and conditions, and will escape to another plane of existence if attacked.
Items are delivered via a one-way portal from a purpose-made dimension.

rows: Hunk of Dragon's Hoard Fool's Gold
Eye Patch with Goofy Skull Design
Book, "Bones. Are they real? A Skeptic's Account"
Book, "Mortals: What Are They and Why Do They Even Bother Existing?"
Pocket Lint, Candy Wrapper, and a Copper Coin
Book, "Skeletons: Cute Because of the Way They Are"
Book, "The Grandmaster's Guide to Taking a Bullet, Throwing Yourself On a Grenade, and Taking the First Bite"
Treatise, "The Parental Habits of Dragons and Their Ilk: An Ancient Pattern of Negligence"
Book, "Undying Fervor, A Dead Necromancy Subschool"
Book, "Power is Like a Bird, Jumping From Branch to Branch"
Necklace with Vial of Phosphorescent Dust
Scrying Gacha Ticket (Roll Twice, Choose One)
Deed to a Carrack Sailing Ship
